00017 # Constants related to NaviCell
00018 MAX_GLYPHS = 5
00019 GLYPH_TYPES = ["color", "size", "shape"]
00020 # Identify the categories of cBioportal data as (aliases, biotype)
00021 TYPES_SPEC = dict()
00022 TYPES_SPEC["mRNA"] = (["mrna", "zscores", "mrna_median_zscores", "rna_seq_mrna_median_zscores", "rna_seq_mrna", "rna_seq_v2_mrna", "rna_seq_v2_mrna_median_zscores", "mrna_U133", "mrna_U133_zscores", "mrna_median", "mrna_zbynorm", "mrna_outliers", "rna_seq_rna", "mrna_znormal", "mrna_outlier", "mrna_merged_median_zscores"], "mRNA expression data")
00023 TYPES_SPEC["dCNA"] = (["gistic", "cna", "cna_rae", "cna_consensus", "snp-fasst2"], "Discrete Copy number data")
00024 TYPES_SPEC["cCNA"] = (["log2cna"], "Continuous copy number data")
00025 TYPES_SPEC["methylation"] = (["methylation", "methylation_hm27", "methylation_hm450"], "mRNA expression data")
00026 TYPES_SPEC["protein"] = (["RPPA_protein_level"], "protein level")
00027 TYPES_SPEC["miRNA"] = (["mirna", "mirna_median_zscores"], "miRNA expression data")
00028 TYPES_SPEC["mutations"] = (["mutations"], "Mutations")
00029 TYPES_SPEC["unknown"] = (["unknown"], "mRNA expression data") # If the type of data cannot be identified, consider continuous data by default
00030 METHODS_TYPE = dict()
00031 TYPES_BIOTYPE = dict()
00032 for bt in TYPES_SPEC:
00033     TYPES_BIOTYPE[bt] = TYPES_SPEC[bt][1]
00034     for cat in TYPES_SPEC[bt][0]:
00035         METHODS_TYPE[cat.lower()] = bt
00036 
00037 # Inform what the processing does to the biotype, if -> it changes only some biotypes, if "something" it turns everything to something, see exportData and saveData
00038 PROCESSINGS = ["raw", "moduleAverage", "pcaComp", "geoSmooth", "distribution", "colors", "mutationQuantification"]
00039 PROCESSINGS_BIOTYPE = {"moduleAverage":"Discrete->Continuous", "pcaComp":"Color", "geoSmooth":"Discrete->Continuous", "mutationQuantification":"Continuous copy number data"}
00040 DISCRETE_BIOTYPES = ["Mutations", "Discrete Copy number data"]
00041 CONTINOUS_BIOTYPES = ["mRNA expression data", "miRNA expression data", "protein level", "Continuous copy number data"]

00044 class NaviData():
00045     """
00046     Custom class to store the data and be able to access rows and columns by name.
00047     Args :
00048         data (list or array) : Values of the data to insert in the NaviData object. Must be convertible into a numpy array.
00049         rows_list (list) : names of the rows (samples names)
00050         columns_list (list) : names of the columns (genes names)
00051         processing (str) : name of the computer processing applied to the data
00052         method (str) : name of the experimental method used to get the original ("raw") data
00053         dType (str) : "data" or "annotations", whether the NaviData object contains datas or annotations (Note : this should be left to default, this is used by NaviAnnotations to change some internal variables)
00054     """
00055     def __init__(self, data, rows_list, columns_list, processing="raw", method="unknown", dType="data"):
00056         assert(len(data) == len(rows_list))
00057         for line in data:
00058             assert len(line) == len(columns_list), "Incorrect length of line : " + str(line) + ", length = " + str(len(line)) + ", expected " + str(len(columns_list))
00059         # Informations on the data TODO
00060         self.processing = processing
00061         self.method = method
00062         self.biotype = getBiotype(method, processing)
00063         # Initialise data and indexes
00064         self.data = np.array(data)
00065         self.rows = listToDictKeys(rows_list)
00066         self.rows_names = list(self.rows.keys())
00067         self.columns = listToDictKeys(columns_list)
00068         self.columns_names = list(self.columns.keys())
00069         if (dType == "annotations"):
00070             self.inColumns = "annotations"
00071             self.annotations = self.columns
00072             self.annotations_names = self.columns_names
00073             self.inRows = "samples"
00074             self.samples = self.rows
00075             self.samples_names = self.rows_names
00076         elif (dType == "data"):
00077             self.inRows = "genes"
00078             self.genes = self.rows
00079             self.genes_names = self.rows_names
00080             self.inColumns = "samples"
00081             self.samples = self.columns
00082             self.samples_names = self.columns_names
00083         elif (dType == "old_annotations"):
00084             self.inRows = "annotations"
00085             self.inColumns = "samples"
00086         else:
00087             raise ValueError("dType '" + dType + "' is not valid")
00088         self.dType = dType
00089         # For the iterator
00090         self.itermode = ""
00091         self.index = 0
00092 
00093     def __getitem__(self, index):
00094         if (isinstance(index, int)):
00095             return(self.data[index])
00096         elif (isinstance(index, str)):
00097             if (index in self.rows):
00098                 return( NaviSlice(self.data[self.rows[index],:], self.columns) )
00099             elif (index in self.columns):
00100                 return( NaviSlice(self.data[:,self.columns[index]], self.rows) )
00101             else:
00102                 raise IndexError("'" + index + "' is neither a gene or sample name")
00103         elif (isinstance(index, list) or isinstance(index, tuple)):
00104             result = list()
00105             for ii in index:
00106                 result.append(self[ii].data)
00107             result = np.array(result)
00108             if (index[0] in self.rows):
00109                 assert np.all([idx in self.rows for idx in index]), "Not all index are gene names"
00110                 genes = self.rows.copy()
00111                 for gene in self.rows:
00112                     if (not gene in index):
00113                         genes.pop(gene)
00114                 return( NaviData(result, genes, self.columns) )
00115             elif (index[0] in self.columns):
00116                 assert np.all([idx in self.columns for idx in index]), "Not all index are sample names"
00117                 samples = self.columns.copy()
00118                 for sample in self.columns:
00119                     if(not sample in index):
00120                         samples.pop(sample)
00121                 return( NaviData(result.transpose(), self.rows, samples) )
00122 
00123     def __iter__(self, by="genes"):
00124         if (not by in ["genes", "samples"]):
00125             raise ValueError("'by' must be in ['genes', 'samples']")
00126         self.iter_mode = by
00127         self.index = 0
00128         return(self)
00129 
00130     def __next__(self):
00131         try:
00132             if (self.iter_mode == "genes"):
00133                 key = list(self.rows.keys())[self.index]
00134                 result = [key] + list(self.data[self.index,:])
00135             elif (self.iter_mode == "samples"):
00136                 key = list(self.columns.keys())[self.index]
00137                 result = [key] + list(self.data[:,self.index])
00138         except IndexError:
00139             raise StopIteration
00140         self.index += 1
00141         return(result)
00142 
00143     def __repr__(self):
00144         rpr = "NaviData array with " + str(len(self.rows)) + " " + self.inRows + " and "
00145         rpr += str(len(self.columns)) + " " + self.inColumns
00146         return(rpr)
00147 
00148     def makeData(self, hugo_map=""):
00149         """ Builds a string suitable for NaviCell Web Service from a python matrix of gene/sample values or a NaviCom object.
00150 
00151         Matrix format:
00152         - first line is: GENE word followed by a tab separated list of sample names,
00153         - each line begins with an gene name and must be followed by a tab separated list of gene/sample values.
00154 
00155         Remove genes not present in hugo_map if provided.
00156         """
00157 
00158         # Change header whether we have annotations or real self
00159         if (self.dType == "annotations"):
00160             ret = "NAME\t" + '\t'.join(self.annotations_names) + "\n"
00161             for line in self:
00162                 ret += buildLine(line)
00163         elif (self.dType == "data"):
00164             ret = "GENE\t" + '\t'.join(self.columns_names) + "\n"
00165             for line in self:
00166                 if (line[0] in hugo_map or hugo_map == ""):
00167                     ret += buildLine(line)
00168         else:
00169             raise ValueError("Data type must be 'data' or 'annotations'")
00170 
00171         return("@DATA\n" + ret)
00172 
00173     def exportToNaviCell(self, nv, biotype, dataName):
00174         """
00175         Export data to a NaviCell map
00176         """
00177         nv.importDatatables(self.makeData(nv.getHugoList()), dataName, biotype) # Remove name once in self
00178         #nv.importDatatables(self.makeData(nv.getHugoList()), dataName, self.biotype)
00179 
00180     def saveData(self, baseName="", mode="w"):
00181         """
00182         Save the NaviData datas in a file that can be used in NaviCell, but can also be loaded as NaviData
00183         """
00184         fname = baseName + "[" + self.processing + "]" + "[" + self.method + "].ncd"
00185         if (mode == "a"):
00186             fname = baseName
00187         with open(fname, mode) as ff:
00188             # First line, and first word in the 
00189             if (self.dType == "data"):
00190                 if (mode == "a"):
00191                     ff.write("M "+self.method+"\t"+self.processing+"\n")
00192                 ff.write("GENE")
00193             elif (self.dType == "annotations" or self.dType == "old_annots"):
00194                 if (mode == "a"):
00195                     ff.write("ANNOTATIONS "+self.method+"\t"+self.processing+"\n")
00196                 ff.write("NAME")
00197             for nn in self.columns_names:
00198                 ff.write("\t" + nn)
00199             ff.write("\n")
00200             for ii in range(len(self.rows_names)):
00201                 ff.write(self.rows_names[ii])
00202                 for sv in self.data[ii]:
00203                     ff.write("\t" + str(sv))
00204                 ff.write("\n")
00205             
00206 MAX_GROUPS = 7
00207 class NaviAnnotations(NaviData):
00208     """
00209     Enhance NaviData to contain annotations and associate annotations values with samples. Also reduce continuous data with to many levels to a limited number of interval levels.
00210     """
00211 
00212     def __init__(self, data, rows_list, columns_list, dType="annotations"):
00213         NaviData.__init__(self, data, rows_list, columns_list, dType=dType)
00214         # Get the values for each annotations and which samples are associated to a value
00215         self.categoriesPerAnnotation = dict()
00216         self.samplesPerCategory = dict()
00217         modified_data = list()
00218         modified_annot = list()
00219         for annot in self.annotations:
00220             self.categoriesPerAnnotation[annot] = list()
00221             self.samplesPerCategory[annot] = dict()
00222             reduced = False
00223             # Reduce the annotations set if they are continuous integers with too many values
00224             if (len(np.unique(self[annot].data)) > MAX_GROUPS):
00225                 try:
00226                     values = [float(value) for value in np.unique(self[annot].data)]
00227                     # Define the new annotations
00228                     min_value = min(values)
00229                     max_value = max(values)
00230                     step = (max_value-min_value)/MAX_GROUPS
00231                     new_values = [signif(cat) for cat in np.arange(min_value, max_value+step/2, 1.01*step)]
00232                     new_categories = [str(new_values[icat])+"<X<"+str(new_values[icat+1]) for icat in range(len(new_values)-1)] + ["NaN"]
00233                     self.categoriesPerAnnotation[annot] = new_categories
00234                     # Attribute the new annotations to samples
00235                     modified_data.append(self[annot].data.copy())
00236                     modified_annot.append(annot)
00237                     for cat in new_categories:
00238                         self.samplesPerCategory[annot][cat] = list()
00239                     for sample in self.samples:
00240                         annot_value = float(self[annot][sample])
00241                         if (np.isnan(annot_value)):
00242                             self.samplesPerCategory[annot]["NaN"].append(sample)
00243                         else:
00244                             icat = 0
00245                             while (signif(annot_value) >= new_values[icat+1]):
00246                                 icat += 1
00247                             self.samplesPerCategory[annot][new_categories[icat]].append(sample)
00248                             self[annot][sample] = new_categories[icat]
00249                     reduced = True
00250                 except ValueError: 
00251                     reduced = False
00252             # Non numeric values or with few enough levels are not modified and simply indexed
00253             if (not reduced):
00254                 for sample in self.samples:
00255                     annot_value = self[annot][sample]
00256                     if (not annot_value in self.categoriesPerAnnotation[annot]):
00257                         self.categoriesPerAnnotation[annot].append(annot_value)
00258                         self.samplesPerCategory[annot][annot_value] = [sample]
00259                     else:
00260                         self.samplesPerCategory[annot][annot_value].append(sample)
00261 
00262         if (DEBUG_NAVIDATA):
00263             print("Discretised annotations:" + str(modified_annot))
00264         if (len(modified_annot) > 0):
00265             self.old_annots = NaviData(modified_data, modified_annot, self.rows, "old_annotations")
00266         else:
00267             self.old_annots = list()
00268 
00269 class NaviSlice():
00270     """
00271     A slice from a NaviData array
00272     """
00273     def __init__(self, data, index_dict):
00274         if (isinstance(data, np.ndarray)):
00275             self.data = data
00276         elif (isinstance(data, list)):
00277             self.data = np.array(data)
00278         else:
00279             raise TypeError
00280         if (isinstance(index_dict, dict)):
00281             self.ids = index_dict
00282         elif (isinstance(index_dict, list)):
00283             self.ids = listToDictKeys(index_dict)
00284         else:
00285             raise TypeError
00286 
00287     def __getitem__(self, index):
00288         if (isinstance(index, int)):
00289             return(self.data[index])
00290         elif (isinstance(index, str)):
00291             return(self.data[self.ids[index]])
00292         elif (isinstance(index, list)):
00293             ret_value = list()
00294             ret_name = list()
00295             for ii in index:
00296                 if (ii in self.ids):
00297                     ret_name.append(ii)
00298                 else:
00299                     ret_name.append(self.ids[ii])
00300                 ret_value.append(self[ii])
00301             return(NaviSlice(ret_value, ret_name))
00302 
00303     def __setitem__(self, index, value):
00304         if (isinstance(index, int)):
00305             self.data[index] = value
00306         elif (isinstance(index, str)):
00307             self.data[self.ids[index]] = value
00308         elif (isinstance(index, list)):
00309             if (isinstance(value, list) and len(value) == len(index)):
00310                 for ii in range(len(index)):
00311                     self.data[index[ii]] = value[ii]
00312             else:
00313                 raise ValueError("Length of indexes to change and new values differ")
00314 
00315     def __iter__(self):
00316         return(self.data.__iter__())
00317 
00318     def __repr__(self):
00319         rpr = "NaviData slice with " + str(len(self.ids)) + " elements"
00320         return(rpr)
00321 
00322     def __add__(self, nvslice):
00323         assert(isinstance(nvslice, NaviSlice))
00324         #assert(self.ids == nvslice.ids)
00325         return(NaviSlice(self.data + nvslice.data, self.ids))
00326 
00327 def listToDictKeys(ilist):
00328     """
00329     Convert a list to an ordered dict where each item is a key and gives the id of the item in the list
00330     """
00331     if (isinstance(ilist, dict)):
00332         return(oDict(ilist))
00333     res = oDict()
00334     ii = 0
00335     for key in ilist:
00336         res[str(key)] = ii
00337         ii += 1
00338     return(res)
00339 
00340 def buildLine(line, sep="\t"):
00341     ret = ""
00342     for el in line:
00343         ret += str(el) + sep
00344     return(re.sub("NaN|nan", "NA", ret[:-1]) + "\n")
00345 
00346 def parseFilename(fname):
00347     """
00348     Extract data name, method and processing from the name of the file
00349     """
00350     fname = re.sub(".*/([^/]+)", "\\1", fname)
00351     if (re.search("\.ncd$|\.nca$", fname)):
00352         names = re.split("\[", re.sub(".ncd$|.nca$", "", fname))
00353         dname = re.sub("_$", "", names[0])
00354         processing = re.sub("\]|_$|^_", "", names[1])
00355         method = re.sub("\[|_$|^_", "", names[2])
00356     elif (re.search("\.tsv$", fname)):
00357         processing = "raw" # No processing is done by the R extractor
00358         names = re.split("_", re.sub("\.tsv", "", fname))
00359         ll = len(names)
00360         while (not "_".join(names[-ll:]) in METHODS_TYPE and ll >= 1):
00361             ll-=1
00362         if (ll >= 1):
00363             method = "_".join(names[-ll:])
00364             dname = "_".join(names[:-ll])
00365     else:
00366         return (re.sub("\.[^.]*$", "", fname), "raw", "unknown")
00367     return (dname, processing, method)
00368 
00369 def pca_cov(data):
00370     """
00371     Run Principal Component Analysis using the covariance matrix and returns the eigen-vectors sorted by decreasing eigenvalues
00372     """
00373     cov_mat = np.cov(data)
00374 
00375     # Compute eigenvectors and eigenvalues, linalg returns eigenvectors of norm 1
00376     eig_val, eig_vec = np.linalg.eig(cov_mat)
00377     # Make a list of value-vector tuples to sort by eigenvalue
00378     eig_pairs = [(np.abs(eig_val[ii]), eig_vec[:,ii]) for ii in range(len(eig_val))]
00379     eig_pairs.sort()
00380     eig_pairs.reverse()
00381 
00382     # Create the ordered eigenvectors matrix
00383     eigen_matrix = np.matrix([eig_pairs[1] for ii in range(len(eig_pairs))])
00384     return (eigen_matrix)
00385 
00386 def signif(x, n=3):
00387     """
00388     Keep n significant numbers
00389     """
00390     if (x==0):
00391         return 0.
00392     return(round(x, -int(math.log10(np.abs(x)))+(n-1) ))
00393 
00394 
00395 def getBiotype(method, processing="raw"):
00396     """
00397     Get the biotype from the method and the processing
00398     """
00399     if (processing in PROCESSINGS_BIOTYPE):
00400         transform_biotype = PROCESSINGS_BIOTYPE[processing]
00401         if (re.search('->', transform_biotype)):
00402             modes = transform_biotype.split("->")
00403             biotype = re.sub(modes[0], modes[1], TYPES_BIOTYPE[METHODS_TYPE[method.lower()]])
00404         else:
00405             biotype = PROCESSINGS_BIOTYPE[processing]
00406     else:
00407         biotype = TYPES_BIOTYPE[METHODS_TYPE[method.lower()]]
00408     return biotype
